channel.title: Marijuana legalization
channel.description: I've been hearing one side tell the other side that they're wrong, and vice-versa. I honestly think marijuana should be decriminalized. All that the government has done is arrest innocent people, and waste over $1 trillion. Marijuana grow ops will never stop, they can't stop, they aren't going to stop. Why doesn't the government just give up? Hell, Obama did weed and cocaine in High School. A majority of the people in the white house have done weed. No one has ever died from weed, so what's the deal with it? It's helped me with my schizophrenia. It gives me the ability to talk about mature things without adding in immaturity. It raises me to a new, better level. So why should it be decriminalized? What do you think?

It’s illegal because the government wants all the good stuff for themselves.

item.title: Marijuana legalization
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“lukeashworth, post:29, topic:344712”]HAHAHA what funny about this topic is that most people who are commenting have never had weed. probly never had salvia which is legal weed. They should legalise because in amsterdam the amound of people smoking weed has decreased since its been legal and thats because people get bored and realise that beeing high isnt that good, so this proves that yes most people will be stoned all the time buy after a few years most people wont smoke anymore. Also the goverment are making money out of people smoking weed why do you think they sell blunts and long rizzla in the shops? not to make big roll ups or blunt roll ups, BECAUSE OF WEED. They are making money out of something which we shouldnt be doing and thats funny so yess if other words it should be legal and yes the govement no that they carnt do anything to stop it because in a way they are kinda helping us out THANKS

LUKE :p[/quote]No. Nearly everything about your post is wrong. Also, salvia is an incense, not weed. It’s also related to other incense like K2 and “Black Magic”, which cause schizophrenia so have fun with that. Might I also add that making it legal doesn’t change the way people feel about how much they smoke it. They smoke it because they enjoy it, not because it’s illegal. By the way, the government doesn’t intentionally dispense blunt wraps across the US for people to use on marijuana. The distributors do it for money, not to aid illegal activity… It’s a LOT cheaper to buy blunts and joints to roll tobacco in rather than buying a pack of cigarettes or cigars, and THAT is why they sell them.

Read full topic

item.title: Marijuana legalization
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:26, topic:344712”][quote author=Natey link=topic=441081.msg3241795#msg3241795 date=1276989514]

[quote author=Frell link=topic=441081.msg3241770#msg3241770 date=1276988141]

ITT: Frell spreads more absolute bullshit.

The tax thing is what i’ve always heard from everyone, even smokers. Its easy to tax tobacco because it usually needs a couple preparation steps before it can be sold to customers. But weed IIRC can be grown and smoked, so it would be easy to just buy seeds and grow your own instead of buying it from a store if its legal. And it would probably knock cigarette sales out of the country.

I dont think it makes you stupid or kills braincells or anything like that. I just think its a big waste of time.
[/quote]I smoke a lot more cigarettes than I do weed.
[/quote]Cool. Why, it’s stupid. Don’t give me you’re shit on “it’s addictive”. At 16, you’re young enough to stop, it doesn’t take that much will power.[/quote]

Drinking and smoking cigs hurt your body worse then smoking weed. And they waste so much money over your life span.

Read full topic

item.title: Marijuana legalization
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:15, topic:344712”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=441081.msg3240458#msg3240458 date=1276881920]

There are a number of intilectuals today that have been recorded to have smoked pot. Steve Jobs for example.

yea, and apple sucks.
[/quote]That’ an opinion. His $700 million dollars a year and millions of units of his products being distributed across the world is a fact.

Don’t kid yourself…I think the fact that apple products suck is a…fact.[/quote]Kid myself? Must I go into detail on how far Apple has come in today’s technological world? Yes, there are other competitors that you might feel are better, but Apple was there from the beginning. Many of these leading competitors you put your money on got their ideas from Apple. You’re incredibly ignorant if you go on with this argument. Steve Jobs is incredibly successful and has made a HUGE impact on today’s technological world and society.

Pertaining to the actual topic, marijuana has killed no one. There are no causes of death directly from marijuana. There is, however, mass amounts of crime due to dealing and gangs related to it. This automatically pends it to the blacklist. Also, saying that it’s a gateway drug isn’t technically true. Any drug can be a gateway drug in that case, it’s just a matter of what you’re willing to try first. Marijuana has no violent side-effects.

HUGE MISCONCEPTION
“Marijuana kills your brain cells”. The story behind that goes as follows:
Scientists did a study, obviously in favor of the government, to prove the theory that THC has a fatal affect on your brain cells. It was called the Heath-Tulane Study in 1974. Ronald Regan announced that through elaborate studies from extremely reliable scientists, it’s been proven that marijuana permanently damages brain cells.

HERE IS WHAT THEY DIDN’T TELL YOU:
The subjects were monkeys, and the procedure was through a gas mask. Doctor Heath pumped 63 COLUMBIAN strength joints into the gas mask, within a 5 minute period for 3 months. They never gave them any OXYGEN. When you don’t have any oxygen, of course you’re going to lose brain cells. It’s funny, because in 2005, they actually did a study that showed results in improving brain cells rather than destroying them.

Read full topic

item.title: Marijuana legalization
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I didn’t even want to respond but the misinformation is giving me pains. So for the sake of harm reduction:

This is why it is illegal. It has nothing to do with taxing it.

drugwarrant.com

Drug WarRant

A blog from the front lines of the drug war with news, analysis, and the occasional rant.

Some funny quotes by the man who made it illegal:

"There are 100,000 total marijuana smokers in the US, and most are Negroes, Hispanics, Filipinos, and entertainers. Their Satanic music, jazz, and swing, result from marijuana use. This marijuana causes white women to seek sexual relations with Negroes, entertainers, and any others.”

“…the primary reason to outlaw marijuana is its effect on the degenerate races.”

“Marijuana is an addictive drug which produces in its users insanity, criminality, and death.”

“Reefer makes darkies think they’re as good as white men.”

“Marihuana leads to pacifism and communist brainwashing”

“You smoke a joint and you’re likely to kill your brother.”

“Marijuana is the most violence-causing drug in the history of mankind.”

r0ckstar96:

It’s helped me with my schizophrenia.

Bad idea dude. Marijuana is for mentally healthy people. You’re going to make it worse.

r0ckstar96:

Hell, Obama did weed and cocaine in High School.

So did the majority of parents of everyone here.

jmood128:

1 trillion is nothing for 40 years

When I have to spend a large amount of my income to pay for this shit, it IS a lot. Prohibition hasn’t worked. It never will. And it only makes things worse. Look at alcohol prohibition 'nuff said

The Reaper X:

The Union

+1

But keep it illegal. I enjoy watching our prisons get over crowded. I love releasing rapists and child molesters early because we need more room for non violent marijuana smokers. I enjoy the fact that I can make a fortune from selling it to your children. And an even bigger fortune by cutting it with potentially harmful substances to add weight to it. I take comfort knowing I can join a violent drug gang that deals with smuggling it to the USA from Canada. I couldn’t have any of this if it were made legal

ITT: Frell spreads more absolute bullshit.

Read full topic

item.title: Marijuana legalization
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:7, topic:344712”]Wrong^^ its not legalized because the government cant tax it.

I have never tried pot and never will because i really dont care, but i dont think it should be legalized because i have many friends who started spending all their school breaks and weekends just sitting inside and smoking and if its legalized that influence will go crazy (imagine if Albert Einstein started smoking)[/quote]
You just have friends who can’t make marijuana part of their life and can only make it their life. I have friends like that and I have friends who smoke it seldom. I use it for chronic migraines, chronic motor tics, and anxiety and its the only that helps for the chronic disorders as I have either had bad side effects or allergic reactions to many pills I have been presribed. Marijuana is the safest drug out there and people need to start realizing it. When people have an illness and try pot, their opinion on the drug usually changes as mine did when my problems went away when I smoked.

Read full topic

item.title: Marijuana legalization
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:9, topic:344712”]You can get Marijuana seeds very easily and grow it yourself and sell it, the government cannot tax that unless its an official store.[/quote]But your original argument was that they cannot tax it. They have and already are in some states. There are people that make their own alcohol, in which case the government doesn’t have the ability to tax that, but alcohol is still legal?

Also, you’re talking about wasting time with marijuana pertaining to successful people like Einstein. There are a number of intilectuals today that have been recorded to have smoked pot. Steve Jobs for example.

item.title: Marijuana legalization
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:8, topic:344712”][quote author=Frell link=topic=441081.msg3240418#msg3240418 date=1276878346]
Wrong^^ its not legalized because the government cant tax it.

I have never tried pot and never will because i really dont care, but i dont think it should be legalized because i have many friends who started spending all their school breaks and weekends just sitting inside and smoking and if its legalized that influence will go crazy (imagine if Albert Einstein started smoking)
[/quote]The government can easily tax it. They already do. There are legal marijuana distributors for medical reasons in 14 different states at the moment. It’s called medical marijuana. You can either grow it yourself, or buy it from a distributor.

Also, if Albert Einstein smoked, it would have no “lower educated” result. It doesn’t effect how smart you are.[/quote]
He would have spent time smoking instead of creating his theory of relativity. Its not how much knowledge you have, its how you use it.

You can get Marijuana seeds very easily and grow it yourself and sell it, the government cannot tax that unless its an official store.

Read full topic
